item.title: Somthing like starter =)
item.dc:creator: @superbum1 superbum1
item.description:
@superbum1 wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:4, topic:188906”]Go to client.java and press Ctrl + F.
Type starter in the box, and when you see:
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”)) {
(Or something like that)

Just change starter to the word you want it to be.

For example, if you wanted “rich” to be the word, that line would look like:
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“rich”)) {

Also, if you want to change the items and amounts you get when you type it, just change the amounts after addItem(ItemID, Amount)

So, for 999m cash and 999m manta rays, it should look like:

addItem(995, 999999999);
addItem(392, 999999999);

Hope I helped![/quote]

u didnt…

so shutup…
“starter” is meant to do only 1 time…

thats why u have to add the public void int

if u dont know yr code…
dont answer questions

?

Read full topic

item.title: Somthing like starter =)
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Go to client.java and press Ctrl + F.
Type starter in the box, and when you see:
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”)) {
(Or something like that)

Just change starter to the word you want it to be.

For example, if you wanted “rich” to be the word, that line would look like:
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“rich”)) {

Also, if you want to change the items and amounts you get when you type it, just change the amounts after addItem(ItemID, Amount)

So, for 999m cash and 999m manta rays, it should look like:

addItem(995, 999999999);
addItem(392, 999999999);

Hope I helped!

Read full topic

nets yr no help AT ALL

then u add this in yr command list

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) { if (starter == 0) { addItem(995, 100000); sendMessage("You Gained Your Starter Kit!"); starter = 1; } else if (starter == 1) { sendMessage("NOOOB! YOU ALREADY GOT YOURS YOU GREEDY TWAT"); } }
